basics.name: Shreenaga Tejas Chikoti
basics.label: Quantitative Research & Finance Professional
basics.summary: Masters Student in Computational Finance at Carnegie Mellon University with strong background in quantitative research, machine learning, and financial engineering. Proven experience in strategy design, signal enhancement, and volatility modeling.

work.name: Lloyds Bank
work.summary: Conducted auction strategy research and volatility surface construction for fixed income trading
highlights: Analyzed U.S. Treasury auction behavior to identify systematic trading opportunities around issuance cycles
Designed and backtested auction-driven fixed income trading strategies across U.S. Treasury Tenors incorporating ARIMA modeling and achieving Sharpe Ratio of 1.06 post-2019
Built trading-facing Excel VBA tool to interpolate and calibrate FX option implied volatilities across arbitrary maturities using Malz model for smile construction

work.name: Qube Research and Technologies
work.summary: Developed benchmark strategies and commodity allocation pipelines using machine learning and NLP
highlights: Engineered benchmark strategy using financial indicators and random forests achieving Sharpe Ratio of 1.3 (2017-2021) on R1k universe
Optimized position sizing and signal accuracy through aggregation, scaling, and exponential smoothing
Utilized Hierarchical Clustering with SENT-BERT embeddings on revenue data to categorize 560 companies across sectors (crude oil, petroleum, agriculture, metals, textiles, automotive, steel)

publications.name: IITK at SemEval-2024 Task 4: Hierarchical Embeddings for Detection of Persuasion Techniques in Memes

publications.summary: Developed hierarchical embeddings for detecting persuasion techniques in memes, achieving F1-scores of 0.60 and 0.67 on subtasks 1 and 2 respectively, ranked 19/80 teams globally.

publications.publisher: 2024 IEEE/SICE International Symposium on System Integration (SII)

projects.name: Orderbook Simulator
projects.summary: Designed and implemented a high-performance limit orderbook engine with comprehensive testing framework
highlights: Limit Orderbook Engine (C++): Full support for market, GTC, cancel, and modify orders using object-oriented design and thread-safe execution
Leveraged efficient STL containers (map, unordered_map) and encapsulated logic to optimize trade matching
Developed comprehensive unit testing suite ensuring correctness and scalability

projects.name: Multilingual Detection of Persuasion Techniques in Memes
projects.summary: Led team of 2 in SemEval Task 4, achieving F1-scores of 0.60 and 0.67 across subtasks, ranked 19/80 teams globally
highlights: Analyzed memes to detect persuasion techniques using multimodal learning
Designed novel ensemble architecture integrating CLIP, CDP, and hyperbolic embeddings to capture hierarchical structures in persuasive content
Submitted research paper to NAACL Conference

projects.name: Prior Case Retrieval System
projects.summary: Developed robust legal case retrieval system processing 3,400+ queries against 25,000+ case database
highlights: Implemented BM25 and BERT-based re-ranking achieving F1-score of 0.413 on IL-PCR corpus
Applied advanced NLP techniques: event extraction, dependency parsing, LegalBERT
Optimized long document processing using KL divergence and sliding window methods
